intro: Spergularia confertiflora, commonly known as the denseflower sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white, arranged in dense inflorescences. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Spergularia confertiflora is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in harsh environments.
